com.github.katjahahn.parser

Class PEData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.katjahahn.parser.PEData

  • public class PEData
extends java.lang.Object
    Container that collects and holds the main information of a PE file.

    It is constructed by the PELoader and returned to the caller as result from scanning the PE File information.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

              RichHeader rich)
        Creates a PEData instance.
        Parameters:
        msdos - the MSDOS Header
        pesig - The signature of the PE
        coff - the COFF File Header
        opt - the Optional Header
        table - the Section Table
        file - the file the header information was read from

      • loadAll

        public void loadAll()
        Trigger loading all extra data. Subsequent calls to loadXXX will not need to read and parse the PE file again.

      • loadPDBPath

        public java.lang.String loadPDBPath()
        Loads the codeview structure and returns the PDB path of it. Reads the PE file to do so unless already loaded. This is included because it is an important IoC for malware. For more detailed info about the CodeviewInfo, use loadCodeviewInfo() or load the debug section.
        Returns:
        String containing the PDB path or empty string if not there

      • loadCodeViewInfo

        public java.util.Optional<CodeviewInfo> loadCodeViewInfo()
        Loads the CodeviewInfo object of the debug info structure. Reads the PE file to do so unless already loaded.
        Returns:
        Optional of CodeviewInfo

      • hasReproInvalidTimeStamps

        public boolean hasReproInvalidTimeStamps()
        If this returns true, the timestamps in the headers are invalid because it is a reproducible build.
        Returns:
        true if REPRO debug directory entry exists

      • loadExports

        public java.util.List<ExportEntry> loadExports()
        Loads and returns the export entries. Reads the PE file to do so unless already loaded. Returns empty list if no exports available or something goes wrong.
        Returns:
        parsed export entries

      • hasExports

        public boolean hasExports()
        Check if pe file has any exports. Will load exports if not done already.
        Returns:
        true iff at least one export entry is there

      • hasGroupIcon

        public boolean hasGroupIcon()
        Checks if PE file has at least one group icon. Will load resources if not done already.
        Returns:
        true iff at least one group icon found

      • loadIcons

        public java.util.List<IcoFile> loadIcons()
        Load and return list of icons that are in the PE resources.
        Returns:
        IcoFile list

      • loadStringTable

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.String> loadStringTable()
        Loads the string table (RT_STRING resources) if not already loaded.
        Returns:
        map of string ID and the actual string

      • hasImports

        public boolean hasImports()
        Check if PE file has any imports. Will load imports if not done already.
        Returns:
        true iff at least one import is there.

      • hasVersionInfo

        public boolean hasVersionInfo()
        Check if PE file has Version Info. Will load version info if not done already.
        Returns:
        true iff version info is there.

      • loadVersionInfo

        public java.util.Optional<VersionInfo> loadVersionInfo()
        Loads the VersionInfo resource. Reads the PE file to do so unless already loaded. If several VersionInfo resources are present, only the first one is used.
        Returns:
        version info

      • setMaxManifestSize

        public void setMaxManifestSize(int maxManifestSize)
        Set maximum size in bytes for loading the manifest data.
        Parameters:
        maxManifestSize -

      • loadManifests

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> loadManifests()
        Loads the manifests if available. Returns empty list if not there. Always reads the PE file to do so. Uses the maximum manifest size that was set via setMaxManifestSize(int maxManifestSize) or loadManifest(int maxManifestSize). The default maximum size is
        Returns:
        manifest info as a string list

      • loadManifests

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> loadManifests(int maxManifestSize)
        Loads the manifest resources as strings if available. Returns empty list if not there. Always reads the PE file to do so. This will additionally set the manifest size, so that subsequent calls to loadManifest() use the new size.
        Parameters:
        maxManifestSize - the maximum size in bytes that the manifest is allowed to have
        Returns:
        all manifest files below maxManifestSize as UTF-8 string in a list

      • loadResources

        public java.util.List<Resource> loadResources()
        Obtain a list of resources without having to deal with exceptions. Reads the PE file to do so unless already loaded.
        Returns:
        List of resources. Empty list if resources do not exist or could not be read

      • loadImports

        public java.util.List<ImportDLL> loadImports()
        Obtain a list of imports DLL objects without having to deal with exceptions. Reads the PE file to do so unless already loaded. The import DLL objects contain the referenced symbols.
        Returns:
        list of import DLLs
